title: Federico Fernandez injured in celebrations for Alfie Mawson's winning goal
description: Federico Fernandez suffered a suspected broken nose after being struck in the face while celebrating Swansea's winning goal against Liverpool at the Liberty Stadium.
content:
Fernandez provided the assist for Alfie Mawson's 40th-minute strike and but his joy soon turned to pain during the celebrations.
The Swansea players mobbed Mawson but as Fernandez went in to celebrate with his team-mate, his face connected with the goalscorer's arm after another Swans player jumped on his back.
It proved to be a nasty blow and the 28-year-old, who had blood pouring from his nose, received treatment straight away from the Swansea medical staff.
Luckily for Swansea, it didn't keep him off the field for too long as he played through the pain to help his side to a clean sheet and three points.
Hit play on the video at the top of the page to see Federico Fernandez suffer a suspected broken nose in the celebrations of Alfie Mawson's winning goal as Swansea beat Liverpool at the Liberty Stadium.
